biography.summary: Maria Cantwell is the junior United States Senator from Washington, serving since 2001. A Democrat, she has focused on technology, energy, transportation, and healthcare policy, and previously served in the U.S. House of Representatives (1993-1995).
biography.early_life: Born in 1958, Cantwell pursued higher education and public service in Washington state.
biography.education: Attended the University of Washington; pursued further studies at Northwestern University.
biography.career: Before joining the Senate, Cantwell served in the U.S. House of Representatives (1993-1995). She was elected to the U.S. Senate in 2000 and took office in 2001.

contact.office_address: 511 Hart Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510

committees.name: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

policy_positions.stance: Supports international trade and measures to promote economic growth.
Supports protecting and expanding access to affordable healthcare.

timeline.event: Elected to U.S. House of Representatives (Washington's 1st district)
Elected to U.S. Senate from Washington
